result.execSummary:
The defendant Vickco C Battle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vickco C Battle in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court by all parties and by Charlotte B.  The court does not believe that this is a sex registry case.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction; credit for 0 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-Follow all rules of probation.
-No further violations of the law.
-AODA assessment and any treatment.
-Sex offender assessment and treatment.
-No contact with the victim or her family.
-No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 17 years.
-Maintain employment.
-Other counseling needs to be determined.
-Provide for DNA and pay costs.
-Pay victim witness surcharge and all costs, assessments and surcharges.  Costs imposed in count 2 are to be paid during period of probation.  
FAILURE TO PAY ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS WILL RESULT IN CIVIL JUDGMENT.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 120 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to 15CM2799, credit for 5 days time served, with HUBER for work release.  Defendant to report by 4pm on 11-2-2015.
The court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as a condition of probation as imposed in count 1 and failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief to be filed.

Defendant Vickco C Battle in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is requesting an adjourned sentencing date due to personal issue of defendant.  The state has no objection.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Vickco C Battle in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Sentencing Hearing. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Vickco C Battle in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to both counts:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Defendant advised he may have to register as a sex offender. Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
State is prepared to proceed to sentencing as victim's mother is present, however, defendant is requesting an adjourned sentencing date.  Court takes statement of Castella L.
The court orders that the defendant is not to have any contact with 5004 W. Greenfield Ave, West Milwaukee, WI and if he does then he is subject to Bail Jumping charges.
The court will retain this matter for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Vickco C Battle in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties requesting a plea and sentencing date.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-25-2015 at 08:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Vickco C Battle
Current: 2541 North 59th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53201   (Effective: 06-02-2015)
Prior: 5004 West Greenfield Avenue, #4, West Milwaukee, WI 53214
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Any additional cash bail posted on this case to be returned to the remittur.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with B.T.O.   AND/OR   her residence    AND/OR   her family    AND/OR  her place of school

Defendant Vickco C Battle in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-105

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 38.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/2/15 @ 1:30 pm
